txt.en: 'With no small thanks to Meregyth's care, I am on the road to recovery.\n\n'My father wanted me to send you in to see him, but Meregyth has something to tell you as well. I would suggest that you speak with her first.'
The Boar-tribe Orcs have been defeated, Cúthing is on the mend, and it appears that Meregyth may have a reason to let go of her feelings for Éomer.

'I wanted to hate you for delivering my father's sorrowful tidings, but my father should have told me himself long ago. I should ask your pardon for the way I behaved...you did not deserve that treatment.

'It is queer how things come to pass sometimes. If I had not come here, I would not have met Cúthing. He has taken my mind from the sorrow I was feeling. Thank you for all that you have done, [placeholder].

'You should speak with Thane Cútha now...it would be best not to keep him waiting.'
Thane Cútha is in the Mead Hall of Beaconwatch.\n\nCúthing told you to speak with his father, Thane Cútha.

'While I feel I did what was right as Thane of Beaconwatch, I was wrong not to view the Boar-tribe as a genuine threat.

'Your efforts saved Beaconwatch. If not for you, I may not have had a watch to oversee any longer. You have my sincerest apology for how I treated you.

'It appears that your services here are no longer needed. Others may need your talents elsewhere.'
Meregyth stands near Cúthing, outside the Mead Hall of Beaconwatch.\n\nCúthing informed you that Meregyth wants to have a word with you before speak with his father.
